poem:
"Prelude to a Bargain"

In midnight's vale, hawks dance, 
painting conflagrations cryptic ochre. 
Emergence in arms' distant blush 
shadows cast by muted light. 

Hammers of state do not 
tap - they boom. Yet whispers, 
resounding in halls of power, seek
more than echoes of war. 

Peace, untested, kneads clay hearts. 
New dawn over old sands lingers, 
unseen beyond veils worn thin.
